title: Coronavirus/COVID-19 Information
cleaned_text: Vaccine Policy Update Per [CSU policy](https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/13116180/latest), vaccinations and booster shots against COVID-19 are strongly recommended, but no longer required, for students and employees. Per [CSU policy](https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/13116180/latest), vaccinations and booster shots against COVID-19 are strongly recommended, but no longer required, for students and employees. Anyone who tests positive for COVID-19 needs to self-isolate and report their case online via our [self-reporting form](https://apps.powerapps.com/play/e/default-96b947f8-b97d-4e5e-aeef-1a880b49c251/a/5095ad56-bdee-48ef-ba68-f8508f4da12b?tenantId=96b947f8-b97d-4e5e-aeef-1a880b49c251). Once you report your case, you will receive an automated email with isolation instructions. Please note the COVID-19 Hotline is no longer accepting phone calls, but you can email [covidhotline@csuchico.edu](mailto:covidhotline@csuchico.edu) if you have any additional questions. Anyone experiencing any [coronavirus symptoms](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/symptoms-testing/symptoms.html), even mild symptoms, should self-isolate and get tested for COVID-19. Anyone who has been exposed should get tested 3-5 days after the last exposure, monitor their symptoms, and wear a mask for 10 days from the last exposure. Please note the COVID-19 Hotline is no longer accepting phone calls, but you can email [covidhotline@csuchico.edu](mailto:covidhotline@csuchico.edu) if you have any additional questions.
